presentation.fsa
Class BezierLayout

java.lang.Object
  presentation.GraphicalLayout
      presentation.fsa.BezierLayout
Direct Known Subclasses:
ReflexiveEdge.ReflexiveLayout
public class BezierLayout
extends GraphicalLayout

Graphical data and operations for visual display of a BezierEdge.

Author:
Helen Bretzke

rigidTranslation

private boolean rigidTranslation

computeCurve

public void computeCurve()
Calls computeCurve(NodeLayout s, NodeLayout t) with source and target layouts for this layout's edge.

computeCurve

public void computeCurve(CircleNodeLayout s,
                         CircleNodeLayout t)
Returns an array of 4 control points for a straight, directed edge from s, the layout for the source node to t, the layout for the target node. Precondition: must call updateAnglesAndScalars() before calling this method to ensure that the curve shape is in sync.

Parameters:
s - layout for source node, s != null
t - layout for target node, t != null

isStraight

protected boolean isStraight()
Returns true iff the edge is close enough to straight; i.e. has tangents within angle EPSILON of being parallel to to a straight edge.

Returns:
true iff the edge is straight enough

computeCurve

public void computeCurve(CircleNodeLayout s,
                         java.awt.geom.Point2D.Float endPoint)
Computes and stores the control points for a straight, directed edge from s, the layout for the source node to endpoint c2.

Parameters:
s - layout for source node
endPoint - endpoint for the edge

updateAnglesAndScalars

private void updateAnglesAndScalars()
Computes and store the shape of the curve so that it can be preserved under compression or expansion due to movement of its end nodes. Computes and stores: s1 scalar |(CTRL1 - P1)|/|(P2-P1)| s2 scalar |(CTRL2 - P2)|/|(P1-P2)| angle1 angle between (CTRL1 - P1) and (P2-P1) angle2 angle between (CTRL2 - P2) and (P1-P2) In case of self-loop stores angles from UNIT_VERTICAL to (CTRL2 - P2) and (CTRL1 - P1) and scalars are simply the lengths of (CTRL2 - P2) and (CTRL1 - P1).

setPoint

public void setPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D point,
                     int index)
Sets the control point with the given index to point. Precondition: index is a valid index i.e. P1, P2, CTRL1, CTRL2. Precondition: point != null

Parameters:
point - the value of the control point
index - the index of the control point to be set

getVisibleCurve

public java.awt.geom.CubicCurve2D getVisibleCurve()
Returns the visible portion of the curve i.e. the part that is outside the boundaries of both source and target nodes; null if no such segment exists.

Returns:
the portion of the curve that is external to both source and target nodes, null if no such segment exists

arcMore

protected void arcMore()
Increase the arc on this edge layout. Increases the angle of the tangents to the curve, clockwise around circumference of source node.

arcMore

protected void arcMore(boolean clockwise)
Increase the arc on this edge layout. Increases the angle of the tangents to the curve, clockwise around circumference of source node if clockwise, otherwise counter-clockwise.

Parameters:
clockwise -

arcLess

protected void arcLess()
Decreases angles of tangents to curve by DEFAULT_CONTROL_HANDLE_ANGLE / 2 and tangent length by 20%. If angle < DEFAULT_CONTROL_HANDLE_ANGLE / 2, set it to 0 (i.e. flatten the curve).

straighten

protected void straighten()
Straightens the curve representing the edge to a straight line.
